title: Ian Eskelin
text:
Ian Eskelin (born October 17, 1969), is a <a href="record%20producer">record producer</a>, songwriter, solo artist, and founding member and lead singer of the Grammy-nominated <a href="Christian%20rock">Christian rock</a> band <a href="All%20Star%20United">All Star United</a>, and president of recording and publishing company Radiate Music. He won the <a href="Dove%20Award">Dove Award</a> for "Producer of the Year" in 2011 and 2008, and was nominated for the same award in 2007, 2009, 2010, and 2012. Eskelin also has received multiple Dove and Grammy nominations for his songwriting and production work working with artists such as <a href="Francesca%20Battistelli">Francesca Battistelli</a> "Holy Spirit", <a href="7eventh%20Time%20Down">7eventh Time Down</a> "God Is on the Move", <a href="Sidewalk%20Prophets">Sidewalk Prophets</a>, <a href="Chris%20August">Chris August</a>, and <a href="Hawk%20Nelson">Hawk Nelson</a> to name a few. As an artist and writer Eskelin has had more than fifty Top 10 singles in the United States, including 25 No. 1 charting songs. He has additionally had international No. 1 songs in various countries including Japan, Singapore, and Australia. Ian's songs have been licensed for use on major networks including <a href="American%20Broadcasting%20Company">ABC</a>, <a href="CBS">CBS</a>, <a href="NBC">NBC</a>, <a href="Fox%20Broadcasting%20Company">FOX</a>, <a href="ESPN">ESPN</a> and feature films.
Biography.
Eskelin was born in <a href="Springfield%2C%20Missouri">Springfield, Missouri</a>, where he attended Eugene Field Elementary School. While attending high school in <a href="Charlotte%2C%20North%20Carolina">Charlotte, North Carolina</a>, he was a DJ and dance music artist, playing keyboard for a local band that opened for <a href="C%2BC%20Music%20Factory">C+C Music Factory</a> and <a href="Information%20Society%20%28band%29">Information Society</a>. He started attending <a href="Wheaton%20College%20%28Illinois%29">Wheaton College</a>, where he roomed with <a href="Rob%20Bell">Rob Bell</a>. During this time, Eskelin released a rave record under the name "Zero" (1992), and also recorded under the name "Brand New Language", which released an independent tape as well as an album with Wonderland Records (1993). He briefly joined the band <a href="Code%20of%20Ethics%20%28band%29">Code of Ethics</a> before releasing a second solo album under the name "iAN", titled "Supersonic Dream Day" (1994). In 1997, Eskelin formed the power-pop band <a href="All%20Star%20United">All Star United</a>.
